Barrack.%20Burnett%20pitched%20a%20few%20Riefenstahlian%20notions%3A%20a%20parade%20up%20Fifth%20Avenue%3B%20a%20televised%20helicopter%20ride%20ushering%20Trump%20from%20Manhattan%20to%20D.C.%20Barrack%2C%20who%20became%20the%20chairman%20of%20the%20inaugural%20committee%2C%20later%20said%20that%20Burnett%20was%20actively%20involved%20in%20producing%20the%20Inauguration%2C%20adding%2C%20%E2%80%9CMark%20is%20a%20genius%2C%20and%20the%20President-elect%20loves%20him.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EI%20spoke%20to%20several%20people%20who%20recalled%20Burnett%20telling%20them%20that%20he%20was%20busy%20working%20on%20the%20Inauguration.%20A%20Democratic%20political%20operative%20who%20was%20involved%20in%20a%20back-channel%20campaign%20to%20dissuade%20big-name%20stars%20from%20appearing%20at%20the%20event%20told%20me%20that%20Burnett%20had%20tried%20to%20enlist%20musicians%20to%20perform.%20%E2%80%9CMark%20was%20somebody%20we%20were%20actively%20working%20against%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20operative%20said.%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20wish%20list%20included%20Elton%20John%2C%20Aretha%20Franklin%2C%20and%20Paul%20Anka%E2%80%94who%2C%20he%20hoped%2C%20would%20sing%20%E2%80%9CMy%20Way%E2%80%9D%E2%80%94but%20they%20all%20claimed%20to%20be%20otherwise%20engaged.%20The%20event%20ended%20up%20with%20sparse%20crowds%20and%20a%20feeble%20roster%20of%20performers.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EBurnett%20eventually%20played%20down%20his%20role%20in%20the%20Inauguration.%20His%20representatives%20told%20me%20that%20%E2%80%9Che%20did%20not%20produce%E2%80%9D%20the%20event.%20One%20person%20who%20knows%20Burnett%20pointed%20out%2C%20%E2%80%9CIt%20wasn%E2%80%99t%20successful%2C%20so%20he%20probably%20doesn%E2%80%99t%20want%20to%20be%20associated%20with%20it.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","On June 26, 2018, the day the Supreme Court upheld President Trump’s travel ban targeting people from several predominantly Muslim countries, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo sent out invitations to an event called a Ministerial to Advance Religious Freedom. If Pompeo registered any dissonance between such lofty rhetoric and Administration policies targeting certain religions, he didn’t mention it."],["p","The event took place the next month, at the State Department, in Washington, D.C., and one of the featured speakers was Mark Burnett. In 2004, he had been getting his hair cut at a salon in Malibu when he noticed an attractive woman getting a pedicure. It was Roma Downey, the star of “Touched by an Angel,” a long-running inspirational drama on CBS. They fell in love, and married in 2007; together, they helped rear Burnett’s two sons from his second marriage and Downey’s daughter. Downey, who grew up in a Catholic family in Northern Ireland, is deeply religious, and eventually Burnett, too, reoriented his life around Christianity. “Faith is a major part of our marriage,” Downey said, in 2013, adding, “We pray together.”"],["p","For people who had long known Burnett, it was an unexpected turn. This was a man who had ended his second marriage during a live interview with Howard Stern. To promote “Survivor” in 2002, Burnett called in to Stern’s radio show, and Stern asked casually if he was married. When Burnett hesitated, Stern pounced. “You didn’t survive ",["em","marriage"],"?” he asked. “You don’t want your girlfriend to know you’re married?” As Burnett dissembled, Stern kept prying, and the exchange became excruciating. Finally, Stern asked if Burnett was “a single guy,” and Burnett replied, “You know? Yeah.” This was news to Dianne, Burnett’s wife of a decade. As she subsequently wrote in her memoir, “The 18-to-34 radio demographic knew where my marriage was headed before I did.”"],["p","In 2008, Burnett’s longtime business partner, a lawyer named Conrad Riggs, filed a lawsuit alleging that Burnett had stiffed him to the tune of tens of millions of dollars. According to the lawsuit, the two men had made an agreement before “Survivor” and “The Apprentice” that Riggs would own ten per cent of Burnett’s company. When Riggs got married, someone who attended the ceremony told me, Burnett was his best man, and gave a speech saying that his success would have been impossible without Riggs. Several years later, when Burnett’s company was worth half a billion dollars, he denied having made any agreement. The suit settled out of court. (Riggs declined to comment.)"],["p","Years ago, Burnett told ",["em","Esquire"]," that religion was “a waste of time.” Dianne Burnett told me that when she was married to him he had no interest in faith. “But you know what? People change,” she continued. “So I’ll give him the benefit of the doubt.” When Burnett met Downey, he reinvented himself. Having made a fortune producing television that was often exploitative, he announced that he would now focus exclusively on “family-friendly franchises,” declaring, “You don’t need to be mean to create drama.” Burnett and Downey launched a production company that has specialized in Christian-themed programming, including a hundred-million-dollar remake of “Ben-Hur,” which flopped. Burnett has spoken enthusiastically to colleagues about the role that prayer and religious devotion now play in his life. He and Downey describe themselves as “the noisiest Christians in Hollywood.”"],["p","Kym Gold told me she thinks that Burnett tends to adapt to his current partner. Before he married Gold, who is Jewish, he took a six-week course in Judaism. “I’ve never known Mark to be religious,” Gold observed. But she noted that “people close to him have said, ‘He follows the wind.’ ”"],["p","Rick Warren, the evangelical pastor, is a friend of Burnett’s. “Mark is not at all the person he was a decade ago,” he told me. “Hollywood is built on money, sex, power, and fame. I would say that none of those things are driving forces for him anymore.” Warren assured me, unprompted, that Burnett is sincere in his Christianity—that he is a “genuine believer” who has committed to being an “ambassador” for his faith. Others who know Burnett noted to me that the Christian community is itself a significant viewer demographic. Burnett talks with colleagues about the “faith audience,” and describes the Christian community as “the largest army on earth.” In 2013, he and Downey produced “The Bible,” a History Channel miniseries that, Burnett claims, was watched by a hundred million people. The Good Book, in Burnett’s words, is “the ultimate period piece.”"],["p","At the State Department, Burnett mentioned religious intolerance “throughout the Middle East,” genocide in Darfur, and the persecution of religious minorities in Myanmar. “I’m simply a TV producer,” he said, noting that he was “far less educated” than his audience. But he was good at communicating with the masses, he went on. He explained his formula for storytelling: “K-I-S-S—‘Keep it simple, stupid.’ ” Burnett said that when he and Downey travel, strangers sometimes “ask her to lay her hands upon them,” as if she were actually an angel. This, he confided, is “the power of media.” He suggested that his position in Hollywood gave him some leverage when it came to pressing politicians to do the right thing: “In the end, nobody wants to look bad in the media.” But Burnett did not cite any controversial White House policies that he hoped to change; he didn’t even mention Trump’s name."],["p","Burnett had remained close to the President. At the National Prayer Breakfast in 2017, he introduced Trump, saying that there “has never been a single bad word between us,” and describing their fourteen-year friendship as “one of the greatest relationships of my life.” Over the years, Burnett and Downey have given to Democratic causes, and in 2008 they donated the maximum contribution to Barack Obama’s campaign. But Burnett has never been especially political. One longtime “Apprentice” staff member told me that Burnett did not welcome the idea of losing his star to a Presidential campaign, noting, “Trump running for President cost Mark a lot of money. He made millions on ‘The Apprentice,’ and Trump killed the franchise.”"],["p","By the time Trump announced his campaign, ratings for “The Apprentice” had fallen, and the show had been repackaged as “The Celebrity Apprentice.” The contestants were now D-list celebrities, including Gary Busey, the zonked-out actor, and Gene Simmons, the repellent front man of Kiss. There were the same business challenges and boardroom eliminations, but the stakes felt conspicuously lower. A lot of the drama in the original “Apprentice” had stemmed from the idea that, for aspiring entrepreneurs, competing on the show could be a career-defining opportunity. For the aging, Botoxed cohort on “The Celebrity Apprentice,” their presence was a tacit admission that their best days were behind them. Still, everyone gamely pretended to take it seriously. Describing the show in one public appearance, Donald Trump, Jr., said that it could be intimidating for Trump’s children to pass judgment on someone “as accomplished as a Gene Simmons.”"],["p","In the opening episode of Season 11, the theatrical tension of the boardroom was suddenly punctured by an electronic trill. “Whose cell phone?” Trump growled."],["inline-embed",{"type":"callout","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22callout%22%2C%22name%22%3A%22inset-left%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c1af2938822322ea4b3b530%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522caption%2522%253A%2522%2522%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%225c1af2938822322ea4b3b530%5C%22%3E%3C%2Finline-embed%3E%22%2C%22attrs%22%3A%7B%7D%7D","ref":""},["inline-embed",{"type":"cartoon","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22cartoon%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22%2Fcartoon%2F5c1af2938822322ea4b3b530%22%2C%22width%22%3A%22%22%2C%22height%22%3A%22%22%2C%22caption%22%3A%22%22%7D","ref":"5c1af2938822322ea4b3b530"}]],["p","“How do I turn this off?” Busey stuttered, fumbling with the tiny buttons."],["p","“Gary, turn your cell phone off!” Trump said. It is strange to watch this kind of malarkey now and consider that only a few years later one of these men would be President."],["p","“Donald mentioned a number of times, ‘Maybe I’ll run for President one day,’ ” Burnett told the Washington ",["em","Post"]," in January, 2016. “And sad to say, politics is kind of a TV show.” When Burnett was asked whether he supported Trump’s candidacy, he deflected the question, retreating behind his conceit that politics is simply entertainment by other means. “I have no idea about the politics,” he said, adding, “I have had great fun—great fun—watching it.”"],["p","After Trump won the election, he turned to his old friend for advice on the inaugural festivities. Like a starlet who keeps returning to a favorite director, Trump had always loved the way that Burnett made him look. Burnett was summoned to New York for a consultation with the President-elect and another Trump confidant, the financier Tom Barrack. Burnett pitched a few Riefenstahlian notions: a parade up Fifth Avenue; a televised helicopter ride ushering Trump from Manhattan to D.C. Barrack, who became the chairman of the inaugural committee, later said that Burnett was actively involved in producing the Inauguration, adding, “Mark is a genius, and the President-elect loves him.”"],["p","I spoke to several people who recalled Burnett telling them that he was busy working on the Inauguration. A Democratic political operative who was involved in a back-channel campaign to dissuade big-name stars from appearing at the event told me that Burnett had tried to enlist musicians to perform. “Mark was somebody we were actively working against,” the operative said. Trump’s wish list included Elton John, Aretha Franklin, and Paul Anka—who, he hoped, would sing “My Way”—but they all claimed to be otherwise engaged. The event ended up with sparse crowds and a feeble roster of performers."],["p","Burnett eventually played down his role in the Inauguration. His representatives told me that “he did not produce” the event. One person who knows Burnett pointed out, “It wasn’t successful, so he probably doesn’t want to be associated with it.”"]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EOn%20October%208%2C%202016%2C%20the%20day%20after%20the%20Washington%20%3Cem%3EPost%3C%2Fem%3E%20released%20the%20%E2%80%9CAccess%20Hollywood%E2%80%9D%20tape%20in%20which%20Trump%20was%20caught%20on%20a%20hot%20mike%20bantering%20about%20grabbing%20women%E2%80%99s%20crotches%2C%20Bill%20Pruitt%20tweeted%2C%20%E2%80%9CAs%20a%20producer%20on%20seasons%201%20%26amp%3B%202%20of%20%23theapprentice%20I%20assure%20you%3A%20when%20it%20comes%20to%20the%20%23trumptapes%20there%20are%20far%20worse.%E2%80%9D%20In%20other%20interviews%2C%20Pruitt%20said%20that%2C%20during%20his%20time%20on%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Apprentice%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%E2%80%99d%20heard%20Trump%20make%20not%20only%20sexist%20statements%20but%20also%20racist%20ones.%20This%20was%20not%20so%20difficult%20to%20imagine.%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20natural%20idiom%20is%20vulgarity%2C%20and%20the%20targets%20of%20his%20ire%E2%80%94Colin%20Kaepernick%2C%20%E2%80%9Cshithole%20countries%2C%E2%80%9D%20any%20African-American%20journalist%20who%20asks%20him%20a%20tough%20question%E2%80%94are%20clearly%20not%20chosen%20at%20random.%20Part%20of%20what%20was%20mesmerizing%20about%20him%2C%20to%20Mark%20Burnett%20and%2C%20ultimately%2C%20to%20the%20American%20people%2C%20was%20his%20compulsion%20for%20offensive%20talk.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EBut%2C%20in%20the%20heightened%20political%20atmosphere%20of%20an%20impending%20Trump%20Presidency%2C%20the%20notional%20existence%20of%20more%20%E2%80%9CTrump%20tapes%E2%80%9D%20assumed%20a%20potent%20urgency.%20Last%20summer%2C%20Omarosa%20Manigault%20Newman%2C%20the%20former%20%E2%80%9CApprentice%E2%80%9D%20contestant%20and%20aide%20to%20the%20President%2C%20reignited%20such%20speculations%20when%20she%20claimed%20to%20have%20heard%20a%20tape%2C%20recorded%20during%20the%20period%20when%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Apprentice%E2%80%9D%20was%20made%2C%20in%20which%20Trump%20said%20the%20N-word.%20Manigault%20Newman%20produced%20a%20recording%20of%20her%20own%2C%20taken%20surreptitiously%2C%20of%20a%20conversation%20with%20two%20aides%20from%20the%20Trump%20campaign%2C%20in%20which%20they%20appeared%20to%20discuss%20the%20existence%20of%20such%20a%20tape.%20On%20the%20recording%2C%20one%20of%20the%20aides%2C%20Lynne%20Patton%2C%20says%20that%20she%20raised%20the%20issue%20with%20Trump%2C%20and%20that%20he%20said%20he%20had%20no%20recollection%20of%20using%20such%20language.%20%E2%80%9CNo%2C%20he%20said%20it%2C%E2%80%9D%20Katrina%20Pierson%2C%20the%20other%20aide%2C%20interjects.%20%E2%80%9CHe%E2%80%99s%20embarrassed.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EOn%20August%2013%2C%202018%2C%20Trump%20denied%20that%20he%20had%20ever%20used%20racial%20slurs%2C%20tweeting%2C%20%E2%80%9C%40MarkBurnettTV%20called%20to%20say%20that%20there%20are%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3ENO%20TAPES%3C%2Fem%3E%20of%20the%20Apprentice%20where%20I%20used%20such%20a%20terrible%20and%20disgusting%20word%20as%20attributed%20by%20Wacky%20and%20Deranged%20Omarosa.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EThis%20was%20a%20peculiar%20thing%20to%20tweet%3A%20if%20Trump%20had%20never%20uttered%20the%20epithet%2C%20why%20would%20he%20need%20to%20be%20assured%20by%20Burnett%20that%20there%20were%20no%20tapes%20of%20him%20doing%20so%3F%20The%20tweet%20was%20also%20notable%20because%2C%20when%20the%20%E2%80%9CAccess%20Hollywood%E2%80%9D%20tape%20leaked%2C%20Burnett%20had%20taken%20his%20most%20definitive%20step%20toward%20distancing%20himself%20from%20Trump.%20In%20a%20statement%2C%20he%20had%20said%2C%20%E2%80%9CGiven%20all%20of%20the%20false%20media%20reports%2C%20I%20feel%20compelled%20to%20clarify%20a%20few%20points.%20I%20am%20not%20now%20and%20have%20never%20been%20a%20supporter%20of%20Donald%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20candidacy.%20I%20am%20%3Cem%20class%3D%5C%22small%5C%22%3ENOT%3C%2Fem%3E%20%E2%80%98Pro-Trump.%E2%80%99%20Further%2C%20my%20wife%20and%20I%20reject%20the%20hatred%2C%20division%20and%20misogyny%20that%20has%20been%20a%20very%20unfortunate%20part%20of%20his%20campaign.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3ETrump%20generally%20answers%20such%20criticism%20with%20a%20hyperventilating%20rebuttal%2C%20but%20he%20didn%E2%80%99t%20fire%20back%20at%20Burnett%E2%80%94at%20least%20not%20publicly%E2%80%94and%20their%20friendship%20does%20not%20appear%20to%20have%20suffered.%20Scarcely%20two%20months%20after%20issuing%20his%20statement%20about%20not%20being%20%E2%80%9CPro-Trump%2C%E2%80%9D%20Burnett%20attended%20a%20fund-raiser%20for%20the%20President-elect%20at%20Cipriani%2C%20in%20New%20York%2C%20and%20in%20January%2C%202017%2C%20he%20and%20his%20two%20sons%20flew%20to%20Washington%20for%20the%20Inauguration.%20Burnett%20may%20have%20wanted%20to%20downplay%20his%20friendship%20with%20the%20President%2C%20but%20Trump%20felt%20no%20similar%20compunction.%20Last%20March%2C%20at%20a%20rally%20in%20Richfield%2C%20Ohio%2C%20he%20announced%2C%20%E2%80%9CI%20got%20a%20call%20from%20Mark%20Burnett!%20He%20did%20%E2%80%98The%20Apprentice%2C%E2%80%99%20he%E2%80%99s%20a%20great%20guy.%20He%20said%2C%20%E2%80%98Donald%2C%20I%20called%20just%20to%20say%20hello%20and%20to%20tell%20you%2C%20did%20you%20see%20Roseanne%E2%80%99s%20ratings%3F%E2%80%99%C2%A0%E2%80%9D%20(Roseanne%20Barr%2C%20a%20rare%20Trump%20supporter%20in%20Hollywood%2C%20had%20just%20rebooted%20her%20sitcom.)%20%E2%80%9CI%20said%2C%20%E2%80%98Mark%2C%20how%20big%20were%20they%3F%E2%80%99%20%E2%80%98They%20were%20unbelievable!%20Over%20eighteen%20million%20people!%E2%80%99%C2%A0%E2%80%9D%20When%20I%20asked%20Burnett%E2%80%99s%20representatives%20about%20the%20President%E2%80%99s%20characterizations%20of%20his%20exchanges%20with%20Burnett%2C%20they%20declined%20to%20either%20confirm%20or%20deny%20their%20accuracy.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EBurnett%E2%80%99s%20reluctance%20to%20discuss%20the%20Trump%20Presidency%20is%20dismaying%20to%20many%20people%20involved%20with%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Apprentice%2C%E2%80%9D%20given%20that%20Trump%20has%20succeeded%20in%20politics%2C%20in%20part%2C%20by%20borrowing%20the%20tropes%20of%20the%20show.%20Jonathon%20Braun%20pointed%20out%20to%20me%20that%20when%20Trump%20announced%20his%20candidacy%2C%20in%202015%2C%20he%20did%20so%20in%20the%20atrium%20of%20Trump%20Tower%2C%20and%20made%20his%20entrance%20by%20descending%20the%20gold-colored%20escalator%E2%80%94choreography%20that%20Burnett%20and%20his%20team%20had%20repeatedly%20used%20on%20the%20show.%20After%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20announcement%2C%20reports%20suggested%20that%20people%20who%20had%20filled%20the%20space%20and%20cheered%20during%20his%20speech%20had%20been%20hired%20to%20do%20so%2C%20like%20TV%20extras%2C%20for%20a%20day%20rate%20of%20fifty%20dollars.%20Earlier%20this%20year%2C%20the%20White%20House%20started%20issuing%20brief%20video%20monologues%20from%20the%20President%20that%20strongly%20evoke%20his%20appearances%20on%20Burnett%E2%80%99s%20show.%20Justin%20McConney%2C%20a%20former%20director%20of%20new%20media%20for%20the%20Trump%20Organization%2C%20told%20%3Cem%3ENew%20York%3C%2Fem%3E%20that%2C%20whenever%20Trump%20works%20with%20camera%20people%2C%20he%20instructs%20them%2C%20%E2%80%9CShoot%20me%20like%20I%E2%80%99m%20shot%20on%20%E2%80%98The%20Apprentice.%E2%80%99%C2%A0%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","On October 8, 2016, the day after the Washington ",["em","Post"]," released the “Access Hollywood” tape in which Trump was caught on a hot mike bantering about grabbing women’s crotches, Bill Pruitt tweeted, “As a producer on seasons 1 & 2 of #theapprentice I assure you: when it comes to the #trumptapes there are far worse.” In other interviews, Pruitt said that, during his time on “The Apprentice,” he’d heard Trump make not only sexist statements but also racist ones. This was not so difficult to imagine. Trump’s natural idiom is vulgarity, and the targets of his ire—Colin Kaepernick, “shithole countries,” any African-American journalist who asks him a tough question—are clearly not chosen at random. Part of what was mesmerizing about him, to Mark Burnett and, ultimately, to the American people, was his compulsion for offensive talk."],["p","But, in the heightened political atmosphere of an impending Trump Presidency, the notional existence of more “Trump tapes” assumed a potent urgency. Last summer, Omarosa Manigault Newman, the former “Apprentice” contestant and aide to the President, reignited such speculations when she claimed to have heard a tape, recorded during the period when “The Apprentice” was made, in which Trump said the N-word. Manigault Newman produced a recording of her own, taken surreptitiously, of a conversation with two aides from the Trump campaign, in which they appeared to discuss the existence of such a tape. On the recording, one of the aides, Lynne Patton, says that she raised the issue with Trump, and that he said he had no recollection of using such language. “No, he said it,” Katrina Pierson, the other aide, interjects. “He’s embarrassed.”"],["p","On August 13, 2018, Trump denied that he had ever used racial slurs, tweeting, “@MarkBurnettTV called to say that there are ",["em",{"class":"small"},"NO TAPES"]," of the Apprentice where I used such a terrible and disgusting word as attributed by Wacky and Deranged Omarosa.”"],["p","This was a peculiar thing to tweet: if Trump had never uttered the epithet, why would he need to be assured by Burnett that there were no tapes of him doing so? The tweet was also notable because, when the “Access Hollywood” tape leaked, Burnett had taken his most definitive step toward distancing himself from Trump. In a statement, he had said, “Given all of the false media reports, I feel compelled to clarify a few points. I am not now and have never been a supporter of Donald Trump’s candidacy. I am ",["em",{"class":"small"},"NOT"]," ‘Pro-Trump.’ Further, my wife and I reject the hatred, division and misogyny that has been a very unfortunate part of his campaign.”"],["p","Trump generally answers such criticism with a hyperventilating rebuttal, but he didn’t fire back at Burnett—at least not publicly—and their friendship does not appear to have suffered. Scarcely two months after issuing his statement about not being “Pro-Trump,” Burnett attended a fund-raiser for the President-elect at Cipriani, in New York, and in January, 2017, he and his two sons flew to Washington for the Inauguration. Burnett may have wanted to downplay his friendship with the President, but Trump felt no similar compunction. Last March, at a rally in Richfield, Ohio, he announced, “I got a call from Mark Burnett! He did ‘The Apprentice,’ he’s a great guy. He said, ‘Donald, I called just to say hello and to tell you, did you see Roseanne’s ratings?’ ” (Roseanne Barr, a rare Trump supporter in Hollywood, had just rebooted her sitcom.) “I said, ‘Mark, how big were they?’ ‘They were unbelievable! Over eighteen million people!’ ” When I asked Burnett’s representatives about the President’s characterizations of his exchanges with Burnett, they declined to either confirm or deny their accuracy."],["p","Burnett’s reluctance to discuss the Trump Presidency is dismaying to many people involved with “The Apprentice,” given that Trump has succeeded in politics, in part, by borrowing the tropes of the show. Jonathon Braun pointed out to me that when Trump announced his candidacy, in 2015, he did so in the atrium of Trump Tower, and made his entrance by descending the gold-colored escalator—choreography that Burnett and his team had repeatedly used on the show. After Trump’s announcement, reports suggested that people who had filled the space and cheered during his speech had been hired to do so, like TV extras, for a day rate of fifty dollars. Earlier this year, the White House started issuing brief video monologues from the President that strongly evoke his appearances on Burnett’s show. Justin McConney, a former director of new media for the Trump Organization, told ",["em","New York"]," that, whenever Trump works with camera people, he instructs them, “Shoot me like I’m shot on ‘The Apprentice.’ ”"]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3ERandal%20Pinkett%2C%20who%20won%20Season%204%20of%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Apprentice%2C%E2%80%9D%20told%20me%20that%20he%20had%20watched%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20campaign%20with%20a%20growing%20sense%20of%20dread.%20Pinkett%20had%20long%20since%20concluded%20that%20Trump%20was%20racist.%20When%20Trump%20named%20Pinkett%2C%20who%20is%20African-American%2C%20the%20winner%2C%20he%20asked%20him%20if%20he%20would%20consider%20sharing%20the%20title%20with%20another%20contestant%2C%20a%20white%20woman.%20Pinkett%20declined.%20%E2%80%9CThe%20only%20conclusion%20I%20can%20draw%20is%20that%20he%20didn%E2%80%99t%20want%20to%20see%20a%20black%20man%20be%20the%20sole%20winner%20of%20his%20show%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20told%20me.%20In%20a%20recent%20interview%20with%20%3Cem%3EVanity%20Fair%3C%2Fem%3E%2C%20Trump%E2%80%99s%20former%20lawyer%20Michael%20Cohen%20said%20Trump%20told%20him%20that%20he%20had%20not%20chosen%20Kwame%20Jackson%2C%20the%20Goldman%20Sachs%20banker%2C%20to%20win%20in%20Season%201%2C%20because%20%E2%80%9Cthere%E2%80%99s%20no%20way%20I%20can%20let%20this%20black%20fag%20win.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EAs%20a%20winner%2C%20Pinkett%20went%20to%20work%20for%20the%20Trump%20Organization.%20%E2%80%9CThe%20closer%20I%20got%20to%20Donald%2C%20the%20less%20I%20liked%20what%20I%20saw%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20recalled.%20%E2%80%9CIt%E2%80%99s%20like%20a%20person%20with%20bad%20breath.%E2%80%9D%20After%20Pennsylvania%20legalized%20casino%20gambling%2C%20in%202004%2C%20Trump%20applied%20for%20a%20license%20to%20build%20a%20casino%20in%20a%20predominantly%20African-American%20community.%20%E2%80%9CThe%20community%20%3Cem%3Ehated%3C%2Fem%3E%20Donald%2C%E2%80%9D%20Pinkett%20said.%20So%20the%20company%20dispatched%20Pinkett%20as%20an%20advocate.%20Upon%20returning%2C%20he%20said%2C%20%E2%80%9CI%E2%80%99m%20not%20going%20out%20there%20again%20to%20represent%20you%20folks.%E2%80%9D%20The%20Trump%20Organization%20was%20using%20him%20like%20a%20prop%2C%20he%20felt%2C%20and%20he%20did%20not%20want%20to%20sell%20a%20project%20that%20the%20community%20so%20roundly%20opposed.%20The%20casino%20was%20never%20built.%20Even%20the%20grand%20prize%20on%20%E2%80%9CThe%20Apprentice%E2%80%9D%20was%20a%20bit%20of%20a%20fake%2C%20Pinkett%20told%20me.%20His%20Trump%20Organization%20job%20was%20actually%20paid%20for%20by%20NBC.%20%E2%80%9CIt%20wasn%E2%80%99t%20even%20his%20money!%E2%80%9D%20he%20said.%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3EWhen%20Trump%20announced%20his%20campaign%2C%20Pinkett%20and%20Kwame%20Jackson%20decided%20to%20make%20a%20public%20statement%20opposing%20him.%20%E2%80%9CThis%20wasn%E2%80%99t%20about%20policy%20or%20politics%2C%20this%20was%20about%20fitness%20for%20office%2C%E2%80%9D%20Jackson%20recalled.%20%E2%80%9CThis%20was%20about%20basic%20American%20character%20and%20decency.%E2%80%9D%20They%20reached%20out%20to%20scores%20of%20former%20contestants%20and%20planned%20a%20press%20conference.%20In%20the%20end%2C%20apart%20from%20Pinkett%2C%20Jackson%2C%20and%20two%20other%20contestants%2C%20nobody%20showed%20up.%20In%20a%20statement%2C%20Trump%20said%2C%20%E2%80%9CHow%20quickly%20they%20forget.%20Nobody%20would%20know%20who%20they%20are%20if%20it%20weren%E2%80%99t%20for%20me.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cp%3E%E2%80%9CI%20think%20the%20reality%20for%20Mark%20Burnett%20is%20he%E2%80%99s%20a%20Hollywood%20guy%2C%E2%80%9D%20Jackson%20told%20me.%20%E2%80%9CHe%20probably%20feels%20that%20if%20he%20torpedoes%20Donald%20Trump%20he%E2%80%99ll%20torpedo%20a%20part%20of%20his%20own%20legacy.%20And%20it%E2%80%99s%20funny%2C%20because%20he%20has%20enough%20money%20and%20enough%20power%20in%20Hollywood%20that%20he%20%3Cem%3Ecould%3C%2Fem%3E%20actually%20afford%20to%20speak%20up.%E2%80%9D%20Burnett%E2%80%99s%20silence%20%E2%80%9Cis%20abdication%2C%E2%80%9D%20Jackson%20said.%20%E2%80%9CIt%E2%80%99s%20collusion.%20It%E2%80%99s%20being%20complicit%2C%20just%20like%20an%20Ivanka%20Trump.%20I%E2%80%99m%20very%20disappointed%20in%20Mark%20for%20that.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%22%7D","ref":""},["p","Randal Pinkett, who won Season 4 of “The Apprentice,” told me that he had watched Trump’s campaign with a growing sense of dread. Pinkett had long since concluded that Trump was racist. When Trump named Pinkett, who is African-American, the winner, he asked him if he would consider sharing the title with another contestant, a white woman. Pinkett declined. “The only conclusion I can draw is that he didn’t want to see a black man be the sole winner of his show,” he told me. In a recent interview with ",["em","Vanity Fair"],", Trump’s former lawyer Michael Cohen said Trump told him that he had not chosen Kwame Jackson, the Goldman Sachs banker, to win in Season 1, because “there’s no way I can let this black fag win.”"],["p","As a winner, Pinkett went to work for the Trump Organization. “The closer I got to Donald, the less I liked what I saw,” he recalled. “It’s like a person with bad breath.” After Pennsylvania legalized casino gambling, in 2004, Trump applied for a license to build a casino in a predominantly African-American community. “The community ",["em","hated"]," Donald,” Pinkett said. So the company dispatched Pinkett as an advocate. Upon returning, he said, “I’m not going out there again to represent you folks.” The Trump Organization was using him like a prop, he felt, and he did not want to sell a project that the community so roundly opposed. The casino was never built. Even the grand prize on “The Apprentice” was a bit of a fake, Pinkett told me. His Trump Organization job was actually paid for by NBC. “It wasn’t even his money!” he said."],["p","When Trump announced his campaign, Pinkett and Kwame Jackson decided to make a public statement opposing him. “This wasn’t about policy or politics, this was about fitness for office,” Jackson recalled. “This was about basic American character and decency.” They reached out to scores of former contestants and planned a press conference. In the end, apart from Pinkett, Jackson, and two other contestants, nobody showed up. In a statement, Trump said, “How quickly they forget. Nobody would know who they are if it weren’t for me.”"],["p","“I think the reality for Mark Burnett is he’s a Hollywood guy,” Jackson told me. “He probably feels that if he torpedoes Donald Trump he’ll torpedo a part of his own legacy. And it’s funny, because he has enough money and enough power in Hollywood that he ",["em","could"]," actually afford to speak up.” Burnett’s silence “is abdication,” Jackson said. “It’s collusion. It’s being complicit, just like an Ivanka Trump. I’m very disappointed in Mark for that.”"]],["inline-embed",{"type":"section","meta":"%7B%22type%22%3A%22section%22%2C%22body%22%3A%22%3Cp%3EA%20recent%20piece%20in%20the%20Ankler%2C%20a%20widely%20read%20online%20newsletter%20about%20Hollywood%2C%20noted%20that%20Burnett%20%E2%80%9Chas%20spent%20the%20past%20couple%20years%20reigning%20over%20his%20corner%20of%20resistance%20territory%20with%20nary%20the%20slightest%20hint%20of%20backlash.%E2%80%9D%20Donald%20Trump%20was%20a%20folk%20devil%20in%20Hollywood%2C%20and%20everyone%20in%20the%20industry%20knew%20about%20Burnett%E2%80%99s%20close%20association%20with%20the%20President%2C%20yet%20no%20prominent%20liberals%20were%20refusing%20to%20work%20with%20Mark%20Burnett.%20It%E2%80%99s%20one%20thing%20to%20%E2%80%9Ctake%20brave%20stands%20on%20the%20red%20carpet%2C%E2%80%9D%20the%20article%20observed.%20%E2%80%9CBut%20you%20wouldn%E2%80%99t%20want%20to%20go%20so%20crazy%20as%20to%C2%A0.%C2%A0.%C2%A0.%20get%20on%20the%20wrong%20side%20of%20a%20mid-sized%20mini-studio.%E2%80%9D%3C%2Fp%3E%5Cn%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22callout%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522callout%2522%252C%2522name%2522%253A%2522inset-left%2522%252C%2522body%2522%253A%2522%253Cinline-embed%2520type%253D%255C%2522cartoon%255C%2522%2520meta%253D%255C%2522%25257B%252522type%252522%25253A%252522cartoon%252522%25252C%252522url%252522%25253A%252522%25252Fcartoon%25252F5c1c4c5a36cecf401921326a%252522%25252C%252522width%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522height%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25252C%252522caption%252522%25253A%252522%252522%25257D%255C%2522%2520ref%253D%255C%25225c1c4c5a36cecf401921326a%255C%2522%253E%253C%252Finline-embed%253E%2522%252C%2522attrs%2522%253A%257B%257D%257D%5C%22%20ref%3D%5C%22%5C%22%3E%3Cinline-embed%20type%3D%5C%22cartoon%5C%22%20meta%3D%5C%22%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522cartoon%2522%252C%2522url%2522%253A%2522%252Fcartoon%252F5c1c4c5a36cecf401921326a%2522%252C%2522width%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522height%2522%253A%2522%2522%252C%2522c
